avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted in warm weather the last few days. It should stiffen and gain even more strength when temperatures drop below 0°C.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It warmed up significantly in all elevations on Sunday and has been warm since. Snow has subsided and melted. Snow has decreased in mountains and is now presumably homogeneous and stable. The avalanche danger is considered low. Snow should stiffen and gain even more strength when temperatures drop below 0°C.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles in the last days. The stability is considered good most places.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles in the last days. The stability is considered good most places.

weatherForecast.highlights: Fremur úrkomulítið næstu daga. Kólnar smám saman á laugardag, frost á láglendi á sunnudag og mánudag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted in the thaw this week. Little snow is left in the area and little avalanche danger.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Significant warming up to mountain tops and subsequent warming in the last week has caused the snow to subside and melt. Little snow is left in the area, except in gullies and is expected to be homogeneous. During cooling over the weekend, snow will get stiffer and strengthen again.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles in the last days. The stability is considered good most places.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles in the last days. The stability is considered good most places.

weatherForecast.highlights: Kólnandi veður yfir helgina og úrkomulítið en lítilsháttar éljagangur í NV 8-12 m/s á laugardag til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided in warm weather this past week and is generally considered stable. A wind slab may have formed in the W part in SW-snow. Thaw has likely impacted snow less above 1000 m and stratification is likely still present in the snow pack.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has subsided in warm weather this past week and is generally considered stable. A wind slab may have formed in the W part in SW-snow. Thaw has likely impacted snow less above 1000 m and stratification is likely still present in the snow pack. Snow will continue to stiffen during significant cooling in the next days.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles in the last days. The stability is considered good most places.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles in the last days. The stability is considered good most places.

weatherForecast.highlights: Kólnandi veður yfir helgina, snýr í NA-átt og lítilsháttar éljagangur nyrst á föstudag. Annars úrkomulítið, kalt og hægur vindur.

avalancheActivity.comment: Slab avalanches released in Lambeyrardalur above Eskifjörður and Bagall in of Norðfjörður on Monday, January 8th. The same day, multiple rather small loose avalanches released in the area. A few dry slab avalanches released in SW aspects in Eskifjörður and Fagridalur the night before January 5th.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided in warm weather and partly melted away. It should widely have become stiff and rather stable. High in mountains, weaknesses can still exist.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It got warm up to mountain tops on Sunday and Monday and then, snow subsided and partly melted. Multiple avalanches released during this temperature change. After this thaw, snow should widely have become stiff and rather stable. In the highest mountains, where the effect of the thaw has been less, there is more snow and a possibility for a deeper weakness. At these high elevations, avalanches can become large if they release.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles in the last days. The stability is considered good most places.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles in the last days. The stability is considered good most places.

weatherForecast.highlights: Tekur að frysta á laugardag og talsverð frost næstu daga og lítilsháttar él. Bætir í úrkomu seinnipart mánudags.
